comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: Not the Euler B.I but one of the many forms of Taubes built in Germany during 1913 / 1914. This one is special as it was fitted with a rotary engine. Will search out tomorrow what this machine is exactly.

comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: As promised, this is the Kondor Taube fitted with a rotary engine, quite unique for a Taube. Source is: John A. de Vries. Taube, Dove of War. 1978

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives
